page.title: 08AMERICANS
page.content: There is a high incidence of "weekend cottages" in and around Hethe where, too, American families from the base at Upper Heyford have sought the quietness of this village in which to live. Some locals say they are not easily assimilated and are apart from, rather than a part of, the local community. Certainly, the village pubs are centres of music cults owing more to the American way of life than the traditional folk and jazz. Young "first-time buyer" village couples are, as in other areas, victims of escalating house costs pricing them right out of their home area where family roots are strong.
